sub_title: WHO Technical Consultant | Associate Professor | Biomedical Scientist | Clinical Investigator
summary:
Specialties: Global Public Health, Immunology, Infectious Diseases, Reproductive and Maternal Health, Microbiota, Cancer, Health and Science education, Translational Sciences, Project Management, Knowledge Transfer, Capacity Building/Strengthening

Experienced Principal Investigator and Team Lead in clinical and healthcare research, and consultant in health innovations and health education in LMICs.
Over 18+ years of experience in the governmental and academic setting, and in multi-stakeholders collaborations with the private (from small enterprises to corporate) and third sectors. 
Passionate and experienced scientist in basic, clinical, translational, healthcare and policy research on main global issues, such as  infectious diseases, microbiota, maternal and reproductive healthcare and cancer. I am a certified clinical researcher with expertise in developing, initiating and coordinating (clinical) research projects and clinical trials with multiple stakeholders and international partners.
Result-oriented, certified project manager, eager to contribute to team success through leadership, sustainable innovation and creativity.
I have a background in biomedical sciences and international public health. I have international experience in wet lab and field research in Italy, France, USA, Sierra Leone, Tanzania, India and Burkina Faso, and consultancy experience in Mexico, Angola, Mozambique and with several other international partners in Europe, Africa and Asia.

https://twitter.com/elenaambrosino
https://profiles.tdr-global.net/Elena.Ambrosino

authors.headline: WHO Technical Consultant | Associate Professor | Biomedical Scientist | Clinical Investigator
WHO Technical Consultant | Associate Professor | Biomedical Scientist | Clinical Investigator

profile_positions.title: Technical Consultant - Genomics for Global Health | Research for Health Dept | Science Division

profile_positions.description:
- Principal Investigator:
Process lead (from design, funding acquisition, Institutional Review Board approval, to implementation and conclusion) of several clinical and intervention trials; 
Research project lead with extensive multidisciplinary stakeholders’ management across geographies.

-Program lead, division Reproductive, Maternal and Child Health within the Research Institute for Oncology and Reproduction (GROW), clustering ~500 research and healthcare staff:
Defined roadmap for the division’s activities in the upcoming 3 years;
Established the 5-years strategic agenda for the multidisciplinary Center for Excellence in Reproduction, Maternal and Child Health, embedding staff across 7 different institutes.

-Member of the Management Team Research Institute:
Leading change management activities and involved in operational decision making.

-Coordinator Graduate School within GROW:
Develop and manage a portfolio of training opportunities that caters to 350+ PhD candidates;
Establish and implement faculty-wide policies focused on innovation in training, graduation process and HR issues, targeting all faculty PhD candidates (>1000).

-Team lead and principal coordinator education:
Led teams of experienced teachers and trainers (20/30 at a time) in the development and implementation of (face to face and blended) undergraduate and graduate courses for up to 150 students.
profile_positions.title: Associate Professor
Assistant Professor
International Consultant - Capacity strenghtening in education in resources limited settings

profile_positions.description:
The field of my work is the global aspects of Public Health Genomics and implementation of genome-based knowledge in developing countries.
I am also involved in the PHGEN II project, second fase of PHGEN, funded by the European Union. The main objective of the project is translational research on the integration of genome-based knowledge and technologies into public health research, policy and practice (PHG) through national, European and international activity.
